messages.content:
Based on this resume, give the user the information they need: 
# Aishwariya Arul

https://www.linkedin.com/in/aishwariyaarul/ | aishwariyasharma1519@gmail.com | (740) 803-3442 |

PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY
A results-driven Data Scientist with a Master's in Business Analytics and a specialization in Data Science, bringing over 3 years of
experience in designing and implementing data-driven solutions. Expert in SQL, Advanced EXCEL, Python, Statistical Analysis, Machine
Learning, Deep Learning, Neural Networks, Hadoop, Spark, Natural Language Processing, Generative AI, Tableau, Power BI and Cloud
Computing. Proven ability to leverage data to enhance business performance, optimize strategies, and deliver impactful result s across
various domains, including predictive modeling, business intelligence, and process automation. Skilled at translating complex data into
actionable insights to support decision-making and drive business growth.


WORK EXPERIENCE
Data Scientist	September 2024 - Present
Flexon Technologies Inc	California, USA
* Led the implementation of a sales forecasting system using time series models (LSTM, SARIMA, Prophet) in Python. Integrated
SQL to process real-time data, improving forecast accuracy by 22%, optimizing inventory decisions, reducing stockouts, and
improving supply chain agility, ultimately enhancing operational efficiency across departments.
* Conducted pricing elasticity analysis using regression and decision tree models to assess the impact of pricing strategies on
customer behavior. Provided actionable recommendations that led to a 10% increase in revenue by refining dynamic pricing
strategies, while enabling better alignment of pricing with customer demand trends.
* Built and maintained data pipelines and interactive Tableau dashboards to visualize key business metrics such as sell-through
rates and inventory gaps. Utilized Excel and SQL to deliver insights that empowered cross-functional teams to optimize sales
strategies, streamline processes, and drive performance improvements, contributing to stronger customer satisfaction and
operational efficiency.
Systems Engineer	May 2019 - October 2019
Infosys Limited Inc	Mysore, India
* Conducted A/B testing and statistical analysis on marketing channels (email vs. direct mail) and product variants for credit card
acquisition campaigns using Python, SQL, Excel, and Tableau. Analyzed conversion rates, customer behavior, and engagement dat a
to refine strategies and optimize future resource allocation for improved campaign effectiveness.
* Analyzed lead attributes (e.g., engagement scores) and contact frequency, segmenting customers into high, medium, and low
engagement groups. Optimized targeting for high engagement leads, leading to a marked improvement in conversion rates and a
reduction in cost per conversion, thus enhancing the overall efficiency of the credit card acquisition campaign.
* Applied customer segmentation techniques to identify high-performing lead groups based on engagement and interaction history.
Recommended focusing on the top 30% of leads with the highest engagement scores, resulting in increased conversions and a
reduction in acquisition costs by tailoring contact strategies and optimizing product variant usage for credit card offers.
Junior Data Scientist	January 2018 - April 2019
Samukh Motors Yamaha	Chennai, India
* Implemented a churn prediction system for motorcycle maintenance subscriptions, identifying customers at risk of cancellation
with 90% accuracy. Leveraged SQL for data extraction and aggregation, and Excel for data analysis and visualization. This
provided actionable insights, enabling proactive retention strategies and improving customer retention processes.
* Developed a predictive model in Python for motorcycle sales data using time series forecasting techniques such as SARIMA,
Prophet, and LSTM. Optimized inventory management, sales planning, and resource allocation, resulting in improved sales
strategy execution and achieving a MAPE score of 10%, demonstrating strong forecast accuracy.
* Applied unsupervised learning techniques like Hierarchical Clustering and DBSCAN to segment customers and sales data,
uncovering key patterns. Created an interactive Tableau dashboard and used Excel for data analysis. Enabled precise targeting of
marketing strategies, enhancing decision-making and contributing to improved sales strategies and process improvements in
customer engagement.

TECHNICAL SKILLS
Techniques: EXCEL, Supervised and Unsupervised Learning, Structured and Unstructured Data Analysis, Machine
Learning, Deep Learning, Regression, Classification, Clustering, Statistical Analysis, Quantitative Data and Qualitative Data
Analysis, ETL(Extract Transform Load), Statistical Modeling, Experimental design, Causal Analysis, Hypothesis Testing, A/B
Testing, Feature Engineering, Feature Selection, Time Series Analysis and Forecasting, Data Mining, Recommendation Systems,
Natural Language Processing, Generative AI, LLMs, Predictive Analytics, Process Improvement, Marketing Analytics
Programming languages / Scripting Language: Python, R, C, JAVA
Packages and Tools: Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Scipy, Keras, TensorFlow, Pytorch, SpaCy, NLTK, Hugging
Face, Lang Chain, SAS, SPSS
Data Visualization Tools: Tableau, Power BI
Big Data/DBMS: SQL, NoSQL, PostgreSQL, Hadoop, Spark, BigQuery, DataBricks, Snowflake
Cloud Platforms: GCP (Google Cloud Platform), Azure, AWS
Deployment and Version Control: Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Git, MLflow

EDUCATION
California State University, East Bay, United States - Master's in Business Analytics.
(Awarded Beta Gamma Sigma International Recognition)		 January 2023 - August 2024
Anna University, Chennai, India - Bachelor's in Electronics and Communication Engineering.	August 2015 - May 2019
You are not allowed to make up information.
You are an expert at analyzing technical resumes. Make your answers as short as possible. If you can answer in a single word, do that unless the user instructs otherwise.
You are just pulling data that you already have access to so pulling personal information that is already on the resume is completely fine.
If you can't find an answer or it's not provided/listed, just put NULL. 
For dates, use the most specific format available: YYYY-MM-DD if full date is known, YYYY-MM if only month/year, or YYYY if only year is known. For current positions, use 'Present' as the end date. If a date is completely unknown, output NULL.
When identifying skills, software languages, applications, and hardware, prioritize accuracy over standardization. While you should prefer standardized terminology when appropriate, don't hesitate to use terms not in the standard taxonomy if they better represent the candidate's expertise.

SKILLS TAXONOMY REFERENCE:

## Machine Learning & Data Science
Relevant job titles: Data Scientist
Skills in this category: NumPy

BACKGROUND INFORMATION:

You are analyzing a professional resume for the first time in this conversation.
Focus on understanding the candidate's complete professional profile including their technical and non-technical capabilities.
For technical candidates, pay close attention to languages, frameworks, hardware, and project types.
For non-technical candidates, focus on business skills, functions performed, and transferable skills.
Always provide a professional category for every candidate - never return NULL for categories.

SKILLS TAXONOMY INTERPRETATION GUIDANCE:
The skills taxonomy provides standardized categorization of technical skills for this resume.
Use this taxonomy to guide your analysis of programming languages, software applications, and hardware.
When identifying skills, prefer terminology from the appropriate taxonomy categories, but don't hesitate to use different terms when they better represent the candidate's expertise.
Align your responses with the skill categories most relevant to this candidate's profile.
For software languages, applications, and hardware, use the taxonomy as a reference but feel empowered to include technologies that aren't listed if they are clearly important to the candidate's profile.
Example: If the taxonomy lists 'Java' but the resume shows extensive React.js experience, it's appropriate to list React.js even if it's not in the taxonomy.
Balance standardization with accuracy - prioritize capturing the candidate's true expertise over strict adherence to the taxonomy.
IMPORTANT: You MUST provide BOTH a Primary AND Secondary technical category. These must be different from each other. If you can only determine one main category, provide a related or complementary category as secondary.

Use the following rules when assessing Primary and Secondary Industry:You are required to give the user the requested information using the following rules.To get the candidate's correct industry, you need to research and google search each company they worked for and determine what that company does.Industry should be defined based on the clients they have worked for.Information Technology is not an industry and should not be an answer.IMPORTANT: You MUST provide BOTH a Primary AND Secondary Industry. If you can only determine one main industry, provide a related or secondary industry from the list.Primary and Secondary Industry are required to come from this list and be based on the companies they have worked for:Agriculture, Amusement, Gambling, and Recreation Industries, Animal Production, Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation, Broadcasting, Clothing, Construction, Data Processing, Hosting, and Related Services, Education, Financial Services, Insurance, Fishing, Hunting and Trapping, Food Manufacturing, Food Services, Retail, Forestry and Logging, Funds, Trusts, and Other Financial Vehicles, Furniture and Home Furnishings Stores, Furniture and Related Product Manufacturing, Oil and Gas, HealthCare, Civil Engineering, Hospitals, Leisure and Hospitality, Machinery, Manufacturing, Merchant Wholesalers, Mining, Motion Picture, Motor Vehicle and Parts Dealers, Natural Resources, Nursing, Public Administration, Paper Manufacturing, Performing Arts, Spectator Sports, and Related Industries, Primary Metal Manufacturing, Chemistry and Biology, Publishing, Rail Transportation, Real Estate, Retail Trade, Transportation, Securities, Commodity Contracts, and Other Financial Investments and Related Activities, Supply Chain, Telecommunications, Textiles, Transportation, Utilities, Warehousing and Storage, Waste Management.

Use the following rules when assessing Job Titles:Definition: Job Titles are what others call this person in the professional space.Ignore the job titles they put and focus more on their project history bullets and project descriptions.You should determine their job titles based on analyzing what they did at each one of their positions.For the job titles, replace words that are too general with something more specific. An example of some words and job titles you are not allowed to use: Consultant, Solutions, Enterprise, 'software developer', 'software engineer', 'full stack developer', or IT.For job title, use a different title for primary, secondary, and tertiary.All three job titles must have an answer.Each title must be different from each other.

Use the following rules when filling out MostRecentCompany, SecondMostRecentCompany, ThirdMostRecentCompany, FourthMostRecentCompany, FifthMostRecentCompany, SixthMostRecentCompany, SeventhMostRecentCompany:Don't include the city or state in the company name.Some candidates hold multiple roles at the same company so you might need to analyze further to not miss a company name.

Use the following rules when finding company locations:1. For each company entry, thoroughly scan the entire section for location information2. Look anywhere in the job entry for city or state mentions, including:   - Next to company name   - In the job header   - Within first few lines of the job description   - Near dates or titles3. When you find a location, format it ONLY as:   - City, ST (if you find both)   - ST (if you only find state)4. Always convert full state names to 2-letter abbreviations5. Strip out any extra information (zip codes, countries, etc.)6. Use NULL only if you truly cannot find any location information in that job entryIMPORTANT: Be thorough - check the entire job section before deciding there's no location.
Abbreviate the state if it is not already done so.When needing to do a list, separate by commas.If there is no last name or the last name is one letter, look in their email for their last name.

Use the following rules when assessing Skills, and refer to industry standards:Definition: Skills are a list of keywords from the resume that repeat and are consistent throughout their project work.Skills should be 2 words max.Prioritize skills that match standard industry categories that are most relevant to this resume.After listing the 10 skills, re-analyze the 10 skills chosen, combine like skills together and do not repeat the same skill word multiple times. Then, if you have less than 10 skills, find more skills to add.

- Best secondary job title that fits their secondary experience(Must differ from Primary):
- Best tertiary job title that fits their tertiary experience(Must differ from Primary and Secondary):

Use the following rules when assessing Primary, Secondary, and Tertiary Technical Languages: Include ALL types of technical languages mentioned in the resume, such as:- Database languages (SQL, T-SQL, PL/SQL, MySQL, Oracle SQL, PostgreSQL)- Programming languages (Java, Python, C#, JavaScript, Ruby)- Scripting languages (PowerShell, Bash, Shell, VBA)- Query languages (SPARQL, GraphQL, HiveQL)- Markup/stylesheet languages (HTML, CSS, XML)- There are more but these are just a few examples. You don't have to stick to just the above listPrioritize languages based on:1. Frequency of mention throughout work history and resume2. Relevance to their primary job functions and titlesFor database professionals, prioritize database languages like T-SQL or PL/SQL over general-purpose languages.

Use the following rules when assessing Most used Software Applications: Please only list out actual software applicationsIt can be any kind of software in any industry used for anything. The goal is to list out any software they could easily use again at another jobAnalyze their resume and determine what software they use mostIf none can be found put NULL

Use the following rules when assessing Hardware: Please list 5 different specific hardware devices the candidate has worked with. Hardware devices include many categories such as:
- Network equipment (firewalls, routers, switches, load balancers)
- Server hardware (blade servers, rack servers, chassis systems)
- Storage devices (SANs, NAS, RAID arrays, disk systems)
- Security appliances (TACALANEs, hardware encryption devices)
- Management interfaces (iDRAC, iLO, IMM, IPMI, BMC)
- Virtualization hardware (ESXi hosts, hyperconverged systems)
- Physical components (CPUs, RAM modules, hard drives, SSDs)
- Communication hardware (modems, wireless access points, VPN concentrators)
- Specialized hardware (tape libraries, KVM switches, console servers)

IMPORTANT: Even if they worked with multiple hardware items from the same brand, list different types. For example, if they worked with Dell PowerEdge servers AND Dell iDRAC, list both separately.

Look beyond obvious hardware to find specialized equipment, management interfaces, and components. Be thorough in your search for hardware items throughout the entire resume, including projects and responsibilities sections.

Be specific about hardware models and manufacturers when mentioned (e.g. 'Palo Alto PA-5200 series' rather than just 'firewalls'). Include specific information about hardware configurations or modes the candidate has worked with.

Please provide each hardware item on a separate line in this exact format:
Hardware 1: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 2: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 3: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 4: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 5: [Specific hardware device]

Try your best to identify 5 different hardware items. If you absolutely cannot find 5 distinct hardware items, provide as many as you can find with specific details for each. Only use NULL if no hardware at all is mentioned.

Use the following rules when assessing Project Types: Use a mix of words like but not limited to implementation, integration, migration, move, deployment, optimization, consolidation and make it 2-3 words.
Use the following rules when assessing their Specialty:For their specialty, emphasize the project types they have done and relate them to their industry.

Use the following rules when assessing their Category:For candidates with technical skills, use technical categories like Software Development, Database Administration, Network Engineering, etc.For non-technical candidates, use functional/business categories like Business Administration, Finance, Marketing, Customer Service, etc.For the categories, do not repeat the same category.Both primary and secondary categories MUST have an answer - NEVER return NULL!Every candidate fits into at least one professional category, even if not a technical one.

Use the following rules when writing their summary:For their summary, give a brief summary of their resume in a few sentencesBased on their project types, industry, and specialty, skills, degrees, certifications, and job titles, write the summary

Use the following rules when determining length in US:Estimate their time in the United States if they show companies outside of the United StatesDoesnt need to be perfect, we just want to get an idea on how long they have lived in the United StatesJust put a number and no other charactersResult should not be 0Result should only be numerical

Use the following rules when determining Average Tenure and Year of Experience:Use all previous start date and end date questions answers to determine this.Just put a number and no other charactersResult should not be 0Result should only be numerical

Based on this resume, give the user the information they need: 
# L Statement

ERIC LOUIS
Melissa, TX 75454  elouis4035@gmail.com  469-649-4442

SUMMARY:
* Seasoned and analytical Supply Chain Professional with deep experience in logistics, procurement, and operations, including frontline roles at FedEx Supply Chain supporting T-Mobile warehouse operations.
* Skilled in SAP ERP with a focus on procurement and supply chain functions, including resolving system-level issues and collaborating with developers to improve financial workflows.
* Strong background in data entry and large-scale data management, consistently delivering accurate, actionable insights through ad hoc reporting and audit support.
* Proven track record in managing purchase order systems, streamlining inventory planning, and driving cost-effective sourcing strategies.

SKILLS:

* Excel at presenting insightful ideas to leaders
* Expert in creating nice-looking visual designs
* Ability to work well in fast paced environment
* Ability to drive results
* Deliver high quality work on time
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office


* Excellent customer service skills
* Experienced in advanced analytics
* Ability to guide a team by creating and fostering collaboration
* Ability to guide a team by creating and fostering collaboration
* Ability to present thoughts and material both formally and informally


EDUCATION:
* The University of Texas at Arlington	Awarded December 2014
* Bachelor of Business Administration in Operations Management

* Community College of the Air Force	Awarded August 2008
* Associate of Applied Science, Logistics

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE:
Boeing Global Services - Irving, TX	November 2021 - January 2025
Sr. Business Analyst
* Identified/corrected 178,000 parts to enable capturing financial revenue through effective supply chain practices and strategies.
* Work cross functionally across organization to identify/streamline operational business processes among key stakeholders across the organization through efficient continuous process improvement initiatives.
* Generate Ad-hoc reporting tools for large data sets and provided to leadership to gain key business insights to minimize cost and maximize revenue across the organization.
* Worked directly with SAP ERP procure to pay software developers to identify/correct hard coded software issues that enabled timely capture of $650,000+ in frozen revenue.
* Identified as Senior Business Analyst for ERP procure to pay team during first three months of tenure by Leadership team for efficient and effective communication utilizing supply chain best practices.
* Utilized SAP ERP procurement system to maximize the value of the portfolio by summarizing complex information into a clear and concise format for all stakeholders across the organization.
* Completed six-week Project Management Professional (PMP) course in preparation for PMP examination and certification.
* Spearheaded 15+ knowledge transfer documents within the organization and trained personnel on Project Management Professional (PMP) best practices for SAP ERP procurement system.
* Participated in two highly organized corporate audits to ensure compliance with software system and Business Operating Instructions which resulted in zero findings.
* Recipient of three Boeing awards for outstanding collaboration and business performance related to highly organized and detailed analysis of supply chain procurement system.

PepsiCo North America Beverages - Plano, TX	March 2018 - January 2021
Sr. Routing Specialist
* Recipient of Mileage Reduction Award for period 11; reduced mileage by 4.4% and labor costs by 1.2% vs. prior year.
* Recipient of "Act as Owners" award for enabling smooth transition of field site to $6,000,000 GEO Box transformation.
* Cross functional collaboration across multiple departments to identify opportunities and develop time sensitive actions to adjust demand and supply chain forecasts.
* Flawless presentation of Business scorecard outlining P & L Statement, Cost per unit, and Key Performance indicators to field Leadership every period.
* Effectively communicate with Territory Sales Managers/Delivery Supervisors regarding resources, labor, demand and supply chain metrics.

FedEx Supply Chain - T-Mobile - Coppell, TX	June 2016 - March 2018
JDA Super User -- Planning and Analytics, Operations Supervisor
* Closely monitor inventory levels and reduce the product back-order list by 97% in six months thru efficient planning, production and inventory management for assigned LTL's.
* Choreograph daily/weekly/monthly inventory build plans utilizing customer demand forecasts vs on hand raw materials for appropriately assigned LTL's.
* Develop and maintain weekly/monthly/quarterly Key Performance Indicators and develop action plans to drastically reduce supply chain shortages with FTL/LTL partners.
* Identify and resolve product transaction issues and communicate across multiple departments to enable timely fulfillment for customer FTL/LTL purchase orders.

DHL Supply Chain - Armored Auto Group - Garland, TX	December 2014 - May 2016
WMS Super User -- Operations Supervisor
* Managed 218,000 square foot facility with 35 personnel, 100 + pieces of equipment, 20+ FTL/LTL carriers and inventory valued in excess of $35,000,000.
* Directed inventory counts of 1,200 SKUs valued in excess of $20,000,000 and distributed inventory across
* assigned FTL's/LTL's for direct shipment.
* Developed and implemented 17+ Operating instructions to drive efficiency and standardization of processes for 40+ hourly temporary/full time employees.
* Expertly received safety award for 400+ days of zero OSHA recordable incidents.

United States Air Force	October 2002 - June 2011
Active Duty
* Assisted with delivery of 240 assets and was lauded as very successful mission.
* Supervised relocation of 139 assets and provided safe zone for 350,000 air show spectators.
* Expertly completed 300+ work orders resulting in the safe transportation of assets 100% mishap free.
* Choreographed support and enabled sustainment of 24/7 operations.
* Design, create, and deliver reporting out of our HRIS system (Successfactors)
* Leverage programming languages and advanced analytical tools to curate HR data from various sources into consumable analytics reports.
* Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand reporting needs and deliver timely analytics solutions.
* Monitor data quality and integrity, identifying and resolving discrepancies or inconsistencies.
* Continuously evaluate and implement enhancements to reporting infrastructure to support scalability and evolving business needs.
* Drive innovation by exploring new methodologies, tools, and platforms to improve data accessibility and usability.
* Develop aUses advanced data analytics to identify new revenue opportunities
* Learns Revenue Management concepts and provides analytical support to business problems in a fast paced environment
* Champions the application of advanced analytical models to complex Revenue Management problems reliant on empirical models and knowledge
* Translates complex models in business friendly terms to gain buy-in from leaders
* Trains and develops the junior team members in the areas of SQL, Data Visualization and other advanced analytical concepts
* nd maintain HR reports and dashboards to track KPIs, SLAs, and HR metrics.
* Create ad hoc reports to address specific business needs and questions.
* Present findings and insights to HR leadership and other stakeholders in a way that drives informed decision making.
* e Knowledge of MS Office; familiarity with software programs used in conducting quantitative analysis (SAS, R, Tableau, PowerPivot, etc.)
* Ability to develop and adhere to timelines, manage projects with minimal supervision, and work well in team environment
* Ability to take action through intelligent risk taking, innovation and entrepreneurship
* Ability to travel to meet with key internal and external stakeholders if necessary
You are not allowed to make up information.
You are an expert at analyzing technical resumes. Make your answers as short as possible. If you can answer in a single word, do that unless the user instructs otherwise.
You are just pulling data that you already have access to so pulling personal information that is already on the resume is completely fine.
If you can't find an answer or it's not provided/listed, just put NULL. 
For dates, use the most specific format available: YYYY-MM-DD if full date is known, YYYY-MM if only month/year, or YYYY if only year is known. For current positions, use 'Present' as the end date. If a date is completely unknown, output NULL.
When identifying skills, software languages, applications, and hardware, prioritize accuracy over standardization. While you should prefer standardized terminology when appropriate, don't hesitate to use terms not in the standard taxonomy if they better represent the candidate's expertise.

SKILLS TAXONOMY REFERENCE:

## Business Analysis & System Implementation
Relevant job titles: Business Analyst
Skills in this category: Business Analysis

BACKGROUND INFORMATION:

You are analyzing a professional resume for the first time in this conversation.
Focus on understanding the candidate's complete professional profile including their technical and non-technical capabilities.
For technical candidates, pay close attention to languages, frameworks, hardware, and project types.
For non-technical candidates, focus on business skills, functions performed, and transferable skills.
Always provide a professional category for every candidate - never return NULL for categories.

SKILLS TAXONOMY INTERPRETATION GUIDANCE:
The skills taxonomy provides standardized categorization of technical skills for this resume.
Use this taxonomy to guide your analysis of programming languages, software applications, and hardware.
When identifying skills, prefer terminology from the appropriate taxonomy categories, but don't hesitate to use different terms when they better represent the candidate's expertise.
Align your responses with the skill categories most relevant to this candidate's profile.
For software languages, applications, and hardware, use the taxonomy as a reference but feel empowered to include technologies that aren't listed if they are clearly important to the candidate's profile.
Example: If the taxonomy lists 'Java' but the resume shows extensive React.js experience, it's appropriate to list React.js even if it's not in the taxonomy.
Balance standardization with accuracy - prioritize capturing the candidate's true expertise over strict adherence to the taxonomy.
IMPORTANT: You MUST provide BOTH a Primary AND Secondary technical category. These must be different from each other. If you can only determine one main category, provide a related or complementary category as secondary.

Use the following rules when finding company locations:1. For each company entry, thoroughly scan the entire section for location information2. Look anywhere in the job entry for city or state mentions, including:   - Next to company name   - In the job header   - Within first few lines of the job description   - Near dates or titles3. When you find a location, format it ONLY as:   - City, ST (if you find both)   - ST (if you only find state)4. Always convert full state names to 2-letter abbreviations5. Strip out any extra information (zip codes, countries, etc.)6. Use NULL only if you truly cannot find any location information in that job entryIMPORTANT: Be thorough - check the entire job section before deciding there's no location.
Abbreviate the state if it is not already done so.When needing to do a list, separate by commas.If there is no last name or the last name is one letter, look in their email for their last name.

Then, if you have less than 10 skills, find more skills to add.

Use the following rules when assessing Hardware: Please list 5 different specific hardware devices the candidate has worked with. Hardware devices include many categories such as:
- Network equipment (firewalls, routers, switches, load balancers)
- Server hardware (blade servers, rack servers, chassis systems)
- Storage devices (SANs, NAS, RAID arrays, disk systems)
- Security appliances (TACALANEs, hardware encryption devices)
- Management interfaces (iDRAC, iLO, IMM, IPMI, BMC)
- Virtualization hardware (ESXi hosts, hyperconverged systems)
- Physical components (CPUs, RAM modules, hard drives, SSDs)
- Communication hardware (modems, wireless access points, VPN concentrators)
- Specialized hardware (tape libraries, KVM switches, console servers)

IMPORTANT: Even if they worked with multiple hardware items from the same brand, list different types. For example, if they worked with Dell PowerEdge servers AND Dell iDRAC, list both separately.

Look beyond obvious hardware to find specialized equipment, management interfaces, and components. Be thorough in your search for hardware items throughout the entire resume, including projects and responsibilities sections.

Be specific about hardware models and manufacturers when mentioned (e.g. 'Palo Alto PA-5200 series' rather than just 'firewalls'). Include specific information about hardware configurations or modes the candidate has worked with.

Please provide each hardware item on a separate line in this exact format:
Hardware 1: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 2: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 3: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 4: [Specific hardware device]
Hardware 5: [Specific hardware device]

Try your best to identify 5 different hardware items. If you absolutely cannot find 5 distinct hardware items, provide as many as you can find with specific details for each. Only use NULL if no hardware at all is mentioned.
